value.0: I hear Tarin escaped the clutches of Pharos Nightcrawler's men... and all due to your courage, <Race> one.
Poor little Tarin... I hope he doesn't end his days at the brutal hands of Pharos Nightcrawler...
If you hurry, <FirstName>, you may be able to catch those men who abducted Tarin at the boathouse in the Market District. I've seen them there before, and it is as good a place to search as any.
<FirstName>, those men... they took little Tarin Lightfingers, didn't they?
<StartAction>[Ghan glares at you angrily, but steps aside.]</Start> Very well then, <Race> one...
I believe they did. I saw one of them carrying Tarin out the door...

I fear for the little Halfling's safety. Those men are accomplices of Pharos Nightcrawler, a powerful crime lord in the city of Laceri. He is known as a cruel man, and Tarin's life may be in grave danger.

Would you leave Tarin to the grisly fate he will suffer at the hands of Nightcrawler's men? You may not approve of the Halfling's ways, but he is a decent enough sort underneath his roguish demeanor...
I'm glad to see you would not simply abandon the little Halfling to his fate. Good. I would not want to see Tarin meet an untimely end at the hands of those brutes...

I wish that I could, <FirstName>, but my island of Charach lies not far from the city of Laceri. Pharos Nightcrawler controls great power in that region, and I fear he would strike against my people in retalliation if I were to get involved.
I believe you will be safe enough. Laceri lies far from here, and Pharos does not have such influence as to strike against Imperial interests.
<StartAction>[Ghan frowns, but nods his head anyway.]</Start> Very well then. I shall simply have to pray that Tarin finds some way to safety.
Should you have a change of heart, I have seen those men often by the boathouse in the Market District. It might be worth looking into, if you decide differently at a later time.
Farewell, <Race> one. I shall pray Tarin Lightfingers escapes this trap, and finds his way to freedom.

It is not cowardice, <FirstName>, but a concern for the welfare of my people. Once, Pharos had dozens of my kin massacred for a simple insult spoken by a foolish Minotaur in Laceri. I dare not risk another such occurrence.
I have seen those men quite a few times around the boathouse in the Market District. That may be a good place to begin the search for him.
I wish you luck, <FirstName>, and shall pray for the safe return of both you and the Halfling.
My days of gambling have ended...
I shall remember your deed for all my days, <Race> one. Know that your kindness has earned the friendship of Ghan the Mighty!
I have shamed my honor... Please, leave me in peace, <Race> one...
Gargh! Now I shall never win back my beloved Vhaarah's Soul Brooch! The fates have deemed to bring doom upon me for my foolishness...
<StartAction>[A look of utter sorrow passes over the Minotaur's craggy face.]</Start> I... I am weak, and unworthy of my Vhaarah's love. My shame shall follow me to the end of my days...
Leave me in peace, <Race> one. I do not wish to share any more words for now...
You are kind, <Race> one, for saying so, but it is hopeless... To win back my Soul Brooch with honor, I must reclaim it in the same fashion it was lost.
I would have to challenge Mylok to another game of chance, but I lost all of my gold to Tarin. I have nothing left with which to wager against Mylok. The fates have indeed doomed me...
<StartAction>[The Minotaur nods, but it is obvious to you that he is no longer truly listening.]</Start> Please, <Race> one... leave me be for now. I wish to be alone.
<StartAction>[The Minotaur's eyes light up when he sees the brooch in your hand.]</Start> You... you have the Soul Brooch?! I... I never thought I would lay eyes upon it again!

<StartAction>[Suddenly, Ghan's expression grows wary.]</Start> I... I cannot accept its return, though... I lost it in a game of chance, and honor demands that I can only recover it in such a fashion...
<StartAction>[Ghan nods reluctantly.]</Start> I suppose there is little I can do to stop you without further shaming my honor... Begone from me, <Race> one, and taunt me no more!

Well, perhaps... I... I had not considered that possibility... Yes, yes, I believe it would! Will you return my Soul Brooch to me, <Race> one? I would be eternally grateful to see it in my possession again.
<StartAction>[The Minotaur's shoulders slump, but he nods grimly.]</Start> Such is your choice, <Race> one. I cannot honorable force you to return the brooch to me...
Your words are true, no matter how little I wish to hear them... Begone from me, <Race> one, and taunt me no more!
Thank you, <Race> one! You have allowed me to regain my honor, and I am grateful. Know that I will remember this deed forever... <StartAction>[Ghan takes the Soul Brooch from your hand.]</Start>
Then I am afraid I could not accept the brooch from you, <Race> one, noble as your intentions may be...
Yes, <Race> one, I am. Your intentions may be noble, but I simply cannot shame my honor any further. Please, leave me in peace so that I may deal with my shame...
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No... I still cannot take it. Thank you for trying to aid me, but I have failed to maintain my honor. It is my doom to accept my punishment...
Please... leave me in peace, <Race> one. I wish to be alone in my shame...
<StartAction>[Success]</Start> I... I had not thought of that... I suppose my honor would allow me to accept the brooch... if you are still willing to give it to me, that is...
This Halfling may yet find his luck to change! I, Ghan the Minotaur, shall show this little man that my people are just as fearsome at the card tables as upon the fields of battle!
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_TARI" >>
I have no time for a Minotaur's foolishness!
I... I'm not sure...
Yes, Ghan, they did...
Tough luck for Tarin. Why should I care?
I'm sorry, Ghan. This is Tarin's affair, not mine.
I suppose I can at least look into it...
We must find a way to rescue him!
Will you aid me in rescuing Tarin?
If you're scared, maybe I should be too.
I don't want to cross him... He sounds dangerous.
Very well. I'll see if I can rescue Tarin.
Sounds like cowardice to me...
I understand, Ghan. I'll do what I can on my own.
I'll see what I can do to rescue him.
<StartAction>[Leave.]</Start>
That's what you get for gambling, fool!
Don't give up yet, Ghan.
Things have a way of working themselves out.
As you wish, Ghan...
I have your Soul Brooch right here.
Guess I'm the lucky new owner of a Soul Brooch...
<StartAction>[Lie]</Start> But I won it from Mylok in a fair game!
Actually, I'm going to keep it for myself...
Serves you right for gambling it away!
<StartAction>[Leave.]</Start>
I was just kidding. Here, take it.
Of course, Ghan. Here you go.
<StartAction>[Truth]</Start> Sorry, I didn't win it back with a card game...
Are you sure you will not accept it, Ghan?
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Mylok cheated you! The dishonor is his alone
